Trial_Design.evidence: 327 patients with FIGO stage IIIB–IV epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) who underwent primary or interval CRS were randomized

Participants.evidence: 327 patients with FIGO stage IIIB–IV epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) who underwent primary or interval CRS

Intervention.evidence: randomized to either surgery with neutral argon plasma (PlasmaJet) (intervention) or without PlasmaJet (control group)

Objective.evidence: We investigated whether adjuvant use of a neutral argon plasma device can help increase the complete cytoreduction rate.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the percentage of complete CRS.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 327 patients with FIGO stage IIIB–IV epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC)

Number_Analysed.evidence: Complete CRS was achieved in 119 patients (75.8%) in the intervention group and 115 patients (67.6%) in the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Complete CRS was achieved in 119 patients (75.8%) in the intervention group and 115 patients (67.6%) in the control group (risk difference (RD) 8.2%, 95% confidence interval (CI) –0.021 to 0.181; P = 0.131)
